thread.title: 21 Things That Have Happened To Every Brit Living In America
thread.title_full: 21 Things That Have Happened To Every Brit Living In America

author: Joshua Zitser
title: 21 Things That Have Happened To Every Brit Living In America

organizations.name: every brit living in america view

text:
View this image ‚Ä∫
Universal Pictures / Via rikkisixx.tumblr.com ID: 10595404 2. It does. View this image ‚Ä∫
NBC / Via i.imgur.com I‚Äôm not even good-looking.
ID: 10595436 3. Strangers imitate your accent. Badly. View this image ‚Ä∫
FOX / Via simpsonsworld.com We‚Äôre not all straight out of Mary Poppins, y‚Äôknow.
ID: 10595516 4. Someone has guessed that your accent is Australian at least once. View this image ‚Ä∫
FOX / Via simpsonsworld.com Oh, come on!
ID: 10595599 5. People ask you about Brexit just *moments* into meeting you. View this image ‚Ä∫
Via imgur.com Nice to meet you, too???
ID: 10595439 6. You legitimately get asked if you‚Äôve ever met the Queen. View this image ‚Ä∫
Via campbellchevelle.wordpress.com Take a wild guess.
ID: 10595497 7. People assume you care about ‚Äúsoccer.‚Äù View this image ‚Ä∫
Via makeagif.com When in doubt, mention Leicester City winning against all odds.
ID: 10595526 8. People assume your school was like Hogwarts. View this image ‚Ä∫
Warner Bros. / Via buzzfeed.com No, we didn‚Äôt play Quidditch.
ID: 10595544 9. In reality, it was probably more like something out of Waterloo Road. View this image ‚Ä∫
BBC Three / Via giphy.com Having a cheeky cig at breaktime was a rite of passage. None of that dementor shit.
ID: 10595548 10. It‚Äôs either assumed that you‚Äôre posh AF‚Ä¶ View this image ‚Ä∫
Masterpiece on PBS / Via tvguide.com Pinky fingers up, dahhhhling.
ID: 10595590 11. Or that you‚Äôre basically a peasant straight out of a Dickens novel. View this image ‚Ä∫
FOX / Via simpsonsworld.com Please, sir, can I have some more stereotyping?
ID: 10595592 12. You can‚Äôt drink a cuppa without somebody telling you how English you are. View this image ‚Ä∫
BBC / Via giphy.com This hot cup of tea will warm up my cold, repressed British soul. Let me drink it in peace.
ID: 10595612 13. You can outdrink any American. View this image ‚Ä∫
HBO / Via crockpotmeatballparty.tumblr.com Those three extra years in the pub *really* paid off.
ID: 10595621 14. Somebody will say ‚ÄúI‚Äôm surprised you‚Äôre not used to this‚Äù to you WHENEVER it rains. View this image ‚Ä∫
Via giphy.com Give it a break, Chad.
ID: 10595628 15. You have trouble relating to touchy-feely Americans‚Ä¶ View this image ‚Ä∫
Via goodreads.com Get your mitts off me.
ID: 10595640 16. And you can‚Äôt stand over-friendly shop assistants. View this image ‚Ä∫
NBC LEAVE ME ALONE! FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME?
ID: 10595647 17. You don‚Äôt ~get~ American telly‚Ä¶ View this image ‚Ä∫
NBC / Via wifflegif.com Skins is ours. I mean it.
ID: 10595668 18. And American commercials baffle you. View this image ‚Ä∫
Snuggie / Via giphy.com It‚Äôs no ‚ÄúCompare The Market‚Äù ad.
ID: 10595671 19. You still forget about tax being added to purchases. View this image ‚Ä∫
Via gurl.com Empty my wallet, why don‚Äôt you?
ID: 10595673 20. And you resent tipping culture. View this image ‚Ä∫
GQ / Via gurl.com Go on then. Just take all of my money.
ID: 10595672 21. But most of all, you miss British sarcasm more than anything else in the world. View this image ‚Ä∫
BBC / Via thankyouforlaughing.blogspot.com Americans are just SO good at it. üôÑ
